ticket.title: Scaffolding with name that ends in "ie" does not create or edit correctly.
ticket.original-body:
I ran across this problem by using straight out of the box scaffolding.
rails generate scaffold Lie title:string etc...
This will produce the correct scaffolding but any attempts to create or edit Lie objects results in Null database inserts. This is all again, with straight out of the box scaffolding.
SQL (0.5ms) INSERT INTO "lies" ("created_at", "description", "title", "updated_at", "source", "video") VALUES ('2010-09-09 21:45:29.951629', NULL, NULL, '2010-09-09 21:45:29.951629', NULL, NULL) Redirected to http://localhost:3000/lies/1 Completed 302 Found in 72ms
I tried the same thing with other scaffold names in different rails 3.0 environments and still get the same error. I think it has something to do with the way rails generates the scaffolding names and creates the object @ly throughout the code instead of @lie.
You can get the same problem with any other word that ends in "ie" Calorie for example. rails generate scaffold Calorie does not work either.

ticket.original-body-html:
I ran across this problem by using straight out of the box scaffolding.

rails generate scaffold Lie title:string etc...

This will produce the correct scaffolding but any attempts to create or edit Lie objects results in Null database inserts. This is all again, with straight out of the box scaffolding.

SQL (0.5ms) INSERT INTO "lies" ("created_at", "description", "title", "updated_at", "source", "video") VALUES ('2010-09-09 21:45:29.951629', NULL, NULL, '2010-09-09 21:45:29.951629', NULL, NULL)
Redirected to http://localhost:3000/lies/1
Completed 302 Found in 72ms

I tried the same thing with other scaffold names in different rails 3.0 environments and still get the same error. I think it has something to do with the way rails generates the scaffolding names and creates the object @ly throughout the code instead of @lie.

You can get the same problem with any other word that ends in "ie" Calorie for example.
rails generate scaffold Calorie does not work either.

rails generate scaffold Lie title:string etc...

You can get the same problem with any other word that ends in "ie" Calorie for example.

version.title: Scaffolding with name that ends in "ie" does not create or edit correctly.

version.body:
I am able to create
@@@ ruby rails g scaffold Calorie name:string type:string @@@
And then I am able to hit both
http://localhost:3000/calories
http://localhost:3000/calories/1
I am using rails edge.
version.body-html:
I am able to create

rails g scaffold Calorie name:string type:string

And then I am able to hit both

http://localhost:3000/calories

http://localhost:3000/calories/1

I am using rails edge.
version.title: Scaffolding with name that ends in "ie" does not create or edit correctly.

version.body:
I can create the scaffolding fine.
Creating and editing records with the scaffold only inserts null values. I have gotten the same results in different dev environments.
Ruby 1.8.7 - Rails 3.0.0
version.body-html:
I can create the scaffolding fine.

Creating and editing records with the scaffold only inserts null values. I have gotten the same results in different dev environments.

Ruby 1.8.7 - Rails 3.0.0
version.title: Scaffolding with name that ends in "ie" does not create or edit correctly.
Scaffolding with name that ends in "ie" does not create or edit correctly.
Scaffolding with name that ends in "ie" does not create or edit correctly.

version.body:
I just ran into this same problem. I was able to work around it by adding an inflection:
@@@ inflect.irregular 'Lie', 'Lies' @@@
version.body-html:
I just ran into this same problem. I was able to work around it by adding an inflection:

inflect.irregular 'Lie', 'Lies'
version.title: Scaffolding with name that ends in "ie" does not create or edit correctly.

version.body: The inflector is used to determine the table names. But the inflector isn't perfect. This certainly looks like one of those cases where the inflector doesn't know how to get the plural. In such cases you need to add an inflection in the <tt>config/initializers/inflections.rb</tt> as mentioned above.
version.body-html: The inflector is used to determine the table names. But the inflector isn't perfect. This certainly looks like one of those cases where the inflector doesn't know how to get the plural. In such cases you need to add an inflection in the config/initializers/inflections.rb as mentioned above.
version.title: Scaffolding with name that ends in "ie" does not create or edit correctly.

version.body:
As others have pointed out adding following line solves the problem.
@@@ ruby ActiveSupport::Inflector.inflections do |inflect| inflect.irregular 'Calory', 'Calories' end @@@
version.body-html:
As others have pointed out adding following line solves the problem.

ActiveSupport::Inflector.inflections do |inflect|
  inflect.irregular 'Calory', 'Calories'
end
